DataElement.preferredName: Patient Has Concomitant Genetic Syndrome Eligibility Criteria Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator related to a patient occurs to have a set of symptoms that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Has Concomitant Genetic Syndrome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a patient occurs to have a set of symptoms that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Have Concomitant Genetic Syndrome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.:Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.:a set of symptoms, usually three or more, which occur together and characterize a particular pathological state; for thorough searching see the Permuted Term Index for specific syndromes.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.
Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
A group of signs, symptoms, and clinicopathological characteristics that may or may not have a genetic basis and collectively define an abnormal condition.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have  one of the
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have  one of the following concomitant genetic syndromes: Down syndrome, Bloom syndrome, ataxia-telangiectasia, Fanconi anemia, Kostmann syndrome, Shwachman syndrome or any other known bone marrow failure syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient known to have one of the concomitant genetic syndromes defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known symptomatic Fanconi Anemia , Ataxia-telangiectasia  Syndrome, Bloom syndrome or Nijmegen breakage syndrome

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have one of the following concomitant genetic syndromes: Bloom syndrome, ataxia-telangiectasia, Fanconi anemia, Kostmann syndrome, Shwachman syndrome or any other known bone marrow failure syndrome.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have one of the following concomitant genetic syndromes: Bloom syndrome, ataxia-telangiectasia, Fanconi anemia, Kostmann syndrome, Shwachman syndrome or any other known bone marrow failure syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have Fanconi anemia, Kostmann syndrome, Shwachman syndrome or any other known congenital bone marrow failure syndrome?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have known hereditary diseases characterized by genetic defects of DNA repair mechanisms, including ataxia telangiectasia, Nijmegen breakage syndrome, Werner syndrome, Bloom Syndrome, Fanconi anemia, xeroderma pigmentosum, Cockayne syndrome, and trichothiodystrophy?

DataElement.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
